meanings.definition: To make someone feel nervous or frightened.
meanings.sent1: The loud thunderstorm outside can unnerve my little sister.
meanings.sent2: The horror movie unnerve me so much that I couldn't sleep.
meanings.sent3: The unexpected prank managed to unnerve everyone at the party.
meanings.sent4: The eerie silence in the abandoned house unnerve me like never before.
meanings.sent5: The sudden appearance of the ghostly figure unnerve the brave knight.

meanings.definition: To cause someone to lose confidence or courage.
meanings.sent1: The harsh criticism from the coach unnerve the young athlete.
meanings.sent2: The challenging task unnerve him, but he decided to face it bravely.
meanings.sent3: The playful teasing from his friends only served to unnerve him further.
meanings.sent4: The unexpected failure unnerve her resolve to continue.
meanings.sent5: The intimidating opponent tried to unnerve his opponent with a fierce stare.
